results.title: Neighbours (the remix) - Brook Andrew (Hail Amerika)
results.brief_description: The new work for Neighbours (the remix) is obvious in nature. It repeats American logo. In Australia, I find my life pervaded by Amerikanism. My art practice comments on Amerikanisation within Australian and the world culture and mediums, so with all the current world domination attitudes by Amerika, it pops up again. This time like a resounding hammer bashing down hard on the little people who have no power but to listen and bob heads, ‘yes…I do’. Fear is translated through our determination to buy McDonalds and waver in American soapies, news and perspectives.

results.title: Slow Service
results.material_description: Single channel moving image, colour, silent
results.brief_description:
‘Slow Service’ is a series of portraits shot using a high speed video camera. This camera, which is normally used for filming mine detonations, science experiments and military tests, captures 1000 frames a second. The footage, when played back at 25 frames per second, has been slowed down so that a second of real time takes forty seconds on the screen. ‘I asked the subjects to pose as if for a passport photograph. We see the transition between this artificial pose and their natural instinctive reaction to the bucket of food that is being thrown at them, and then the impact of the food itself.

I liked the idea of capturing a wasteful, slapstick, human gesture using a medium that is normally reserved for ‘serious’ scientists and bomb designers’. (Marcus Lyall, 2004)
results.description:

We see the transition between this artificial pose and their natural instinctive reaction to the bucket of food that is being thrown at them, and then the impact of the food itself.

I liked the idea of capturing a wasteful, slapstick, human gesture using a medium that is normally reserved for ‘serious’ scientists and bomb designers’. (Marcus Lyall, 2004)

results.title: The Other side
results.creator_credit: Advanced Diploma of Multimedia (ADoM), Swinburne University of Technology (formerly Electronic Design and Interactive Media (EDIM) and Zaljko Radic
results.brief_description: A 3D animation without dialogue. Kids will love this simple story with a Jules Verne influence. A moustached man in a brightly coloured flying machine travels through a surreal futuristic landscape searching for a lost city…Created using Lightwave, After FX and Premiere

results.title: M'eza (preview for an interactive installation)
results.creator_credit: Advanced Diploma of Multimedia (ADoM), Swinburne University of Technology (formerly Electronic Design and Interactive Media (EDIM) and Anita Bacic
results.brief_description: As part of the end of year screening for the Swinburne, EDIM (Electronic Design and Interactive Media) course - those students who had completed interactive coursework were required to create a linear representation of their work for the showreel. M’eza is an immersive art-piece screened at Videobrasil Electronic Art festival 2003. Artist should be contacted at a later date for a further explanation of the work

Tis student should be contacted and asked to submit to the Interactive collection

results.title: The Girl I love: music video for the band Positronic
results.creator_credit: Advanced Diploma of Multimedia (ADoM), Swinburne University of Technology (formerly Electronic Design and Interactive Media (EDIM) and Stephen Clarke
results.brief_description: This animated music video was created in 3D studio Max for student’s band - Positronic. Although it was the first time that he had used this software, he makes the most of simple scenes, metaphorical imagery and 3D ariel effects to effectively communicate the song’s message - A small town girl leaves her home to find fame and fortune in the big city, leaving beind her boyfriend who must come to terms with her departure.
